data.enText: too ready to believe things and therefore easy to trick

simple_means.memory_skill: cred 相信，信任 + ulous 多…的 → 过分相信 → 轻信的

tr: disposed to believe on little evidence
example: the gimmick would convince none but the most credulous

tr: showing a lack of judgment or experience
example: so credulous he believes everything he reads

value.def: If you describe someone as credulous, you have a low opinion of them because they are too ready to believe what people tell them and are easily deceived.

example.ex: ...quack doctors charming money out of the pockets of credulous health-hungry citizens.
example.tran: 从那些渴望健康而又容易上当受骗的市民那里骗钱的江湖郎中

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to believe, to trust 相信, 信任
rootsaffixes.title: creed, cred

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + credit 信任；学分 → 信任；委任
cred 相信，信任 + ence 表行为 → 相信；凭证
cred 相信，信任 + ent 表名词 + ial …的 → 让人相信的东西 → 凭据
cred 相信，信任 + ible 可…的 → 可靠的，可信的
cred 相信，信任 + it → 信任；学分
cred 相信，信任 + ulous 多…的 → 过分相信 → 轻信的
dis 不 + credit 信任；学分 → 不信任，怀疑
in 不 + cred 相信，信任 + ulity → 不轻信
in 不 + credulous 轻信的 → 不轻信的
